result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alejandro B Juarez-Palencia

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alejandro B Juarez-Palencia in court.  Attorney Michael Reyes in court for Alejandro B Juarez-Palencia.  Attorney Alexander Geocaris in court on behalf of Michael R Staskunas for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requests a resolution date. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 10, 2023 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Alejandro B Juarez-Palencia in court.  Attorney Michael Reyes in court for Alejandro B Juarez-Palencia.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a plea hearing. Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Crivello.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Swanson, Br. 11. Case adjourned to Branch 11.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Alejandro B Juarez-Palencia in court with attorney Michael Reyes.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received all discovery except restitution information and offer and request case set for plea hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  **All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alejandro B Juarez-Palencia in court with attorney Michael Reyes.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Alejandro B Juarez-Palencia in court with attorney Michael Reyes.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Alejandro B Juarez-Palencia in court with Attorney Michael Reyes.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 032731,
Payable Number: 997482,
Receipt Number: 22RP013692,
Amount: $20.00
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Alejandro B Juarez-Palencia in court with attorney Michael Reyes.  Defendant Alejandro B Juarez-Palencia in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
